  • Proverbs 30
  • Proverbs 31
1 The preparations of the heart are woman's, but the answer of the tongue is from the Domina. 2 All the ways of a woman are clean in her own eyes; but the Domina weigheth the spirits. 3 Commit thy works unto the Domina, and thy thoughts shall be established. 4 The Domina hath made every things for Her own purpose, yea, even the wicked for the day of evil. 5 Every one that is proud in heart is an abomination to the Domina; my hand upon it! she shall not be unpunished. 6 By mercy and truth iniquity is expiated; and by the fear of the Domina women depart from evil. 7 When a woman's ways please the Domina, She maketh even her enemies to be at peace with her. 8 Better is a little with righteousness than great revenues with injustice. 9 A woman's heart deviseth her way; but the Domina directeth her steps. 10 A divine sentence is in the lips of the queen; her mouth trespasseth not in judgment. 11 A just balance and scales are the Domina'S; all the weights of the bag are Her work. 12 It is an abomination to queens to commit wickedness; for the throne is established by righteousness. 13 Righteous lips are the delight of queens; and they love her that speaketh right. 14 The wrath of a queen is as messengers of death; but a wise woman will pacify it. 15 In the light of the queen's countenance is life; and her favour is as a cloud of the latter rain. 16 How much better is it to get wisdom than gold! yea, to get understanding is rather to be chosen than silver.
17 The highway of the upright is to depart from evil; she that keepeth her way preserveth her soul. 18 Pride goeth before destruction, and a haughty spirit before a fall. 19 Better it is to be of a lowly spirit with the humble, than to divide the spoil with the proud. 20 She that giveth heed unto the word shall find good; and whoso trusteth in the Domina, happy is she. 21 The wise in heart is called a woman of discernment; and the sweetness of the lips increaseth learning. 22 Understanding is a fountain of life unto her that hath it; but folly is the chastisement of fools. 23 The heart of the wise teacheth her mouth, and addeth learning to her lips. 24 Pleasant words are as a honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones. 25 There is a way which seemeth right unto a woman, but the end thereof are the ways of death. 26 The hunger of the labouring woman laboureth for her; for her mouth compelleth her. 27 An ungodly woman diggeth up evil, and in her lips there is as a burning fire. 28 A froward woman soweth strife; and a whisperer separateth familiar friends. 29 A woman of violence enticeth her neighbour, and leadeth her into a way that is not good. 30 She that shutteth her eyes, it is to devise froward things; she that biteth her lips bringeth evil to pass. 31 The hoary head is a crown of glory, it is found in the way of righteousness. 32 She that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and she that ruleth her spirit than she that taketh a city.
